accreditation.title: Accreditation
accreditation.content: Access an OSHA-INSTITUTE accreditation and become an Osha-Institute specialist and start taking off as a professional. Our trajectory, the value and recognition that we have established over the years worldwide with our contributions and standards is visible and part of our recognition we want to share with you by being part of our family and representing Osha-Institute anywhere in the world.

degrees.title: Grados
p: Nuestros grados profesionales están acreditados y validados en 78 países a nivel mundial gracias al convenio internacional del foro educativo.
Respaldados por el ISO 21001.
Y garantizados por nuestra acreditación AE (ACREDITED EDUCATION).
Cada uno de nuestros grados cumplen los requisitos exigidos en todo el mundo y son válidos en 4 continentes.

accreditationAE.title: AE Accreditation
accreditationAE.content: AE staff and evaluators are dedicated to providing rigorous, reliable and independent evaluations from conformity assessment bodies according to recognized technical, national and international standards. As a private entity, we comply with our own regulations which It is considered strict and rigorous at the corporate level throughout the world. With our parameters we seek to improve regular and higher education throughout the world. Companies must comply in detail with the norms and standards proposed worldwide. meet strict parameters

accreditedEducationAE.title: AE Accredited Education
accreditedEducationAE.content: It is the most comprehensive, serious and strict compliance multidisciplinary accreditation body that presides globally, with more than 3,500 accredited organizations in approximately 87 countries. AE provides accreditation and acts as architect of the evaluation structure of educational conformity of industry-specific programs.

identity.title: Identity
content: AE, is a non-governmental organization and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Occupational Safety Health Administration Osha-Institute, which is a private and self-governing organization. In accordance with Osha-Institute's autonomous mission of administering procedures and criteria for the accreditation of conformity assessment programs and encourage organizations to prepare and submit such programs for accreditation, AE provides accreditation services, assessment services and training to public and private sector organizations serving the market global. AE evaluates and accredits educational organizations, institutes, universities, etc., (i.e. higher education organizations) according to national and international standards, requirements and programs.
The AE evaluation committee has the specific permissions of verifiers, evaluators and certifiers under the international accreditation consensus.

The status of comprehensive and unanimous signatory based on international accreditation and certification agreements of private and government entities that are immersed in the training, education and certification of professionals around the world.

Through these activities, AE helps the industry, in improving educational parameters and training and certification of professionals, acting as architect of the conformity assessment structure of industry-specific programs.
Learn more about how to obtain AE accreditation here

accreditationProcessAE.title: AE Accreditation Process

1st.p: The Study Center must be an authorized Osha-Institute center or have at least 3 accredited Trainers.

2nd.p: Evaluation of experience, attitudes, aptitudes and knowledge of each member who is part of the educational entity.

p: The educational procedures and techniques are evaluated where the knowledge of the students must have a Passing evaluation of no less than 87 points out of 100.

If the students of the educational entity obtain grades lower than 87 points, it is an indicator that the technique or procedures applied in its management are not adequate for the type of clients it is addressing.
In this process, the educational center must improve quality starting with the training procedures and techniques.

4th.p: Compliance with the establishment of structures for each training program must be strict.
list: And improvement of knowledge and skills.
Upon compliance with this structure, the audit is carried out.
In each country we have compliance inspectors who verify whether the methods of the training structure are applied daily.

5th.p: Company organization. Each company must comply with listing in its staff.
5th.p2: Each of them must comply with the functions assigned to the holder for the improvement in educational quality.
p3: They must be accredited by RAIA (American Network of Accredited Instructors).
Have the accreditation in the subject that is handled in the organization.
They must be managers of continuous improvement.
They must address the necessary knowledge and be transmitted effectively.

p: Accreditation of the professional training center.
In this process, the organization receives the credential as an AE Organization and may use the official logo in the accreditations they manage.
This accreditation is valid for 5 years from the issuance.
At the same time, it has unforeseen annual inspections to verify compliance with it.

accreditationProcessAE.p: Learn more about non-compliance and sanctions here.

non-compliances.title: Noncompliances
p: In case of noncompliance with any of the steps mentioned in points 1,2,3,4 and 5, depending on the severity, you may lose your accreditation or receive an administrative sanction where the use of the logo is restricted.
Failure to comply with the sanction will be discussed in the courts of the country of origin.

list.title: a) noncompliance with points 3.
p: When certifying or accrediting professionals who fail to obtain a passing grade of at least 87 out of 100.
The use of temporary accreditation will be suspended for 6 months.
If the issue is repeated, accreditation will be suspended for 2 years.

list.title: b) Failure to comply with the educational quality structure.
p: Failure to comply with the educational training structure is sanctioned with the effective suspension of accreditation until compliance is achieved.
In the event of a repeat offender, accreditation will be definitively suspended.

list.title: c) non-compliance with the company's organization.
p: Each company must be respectful of AE's proposal.
Keep the assigned staff current and operational.
Comply with the RAIA accreditation for each of the members that make it up.
Failure to comply with this point will be grounds for the total dissolution of the accreditation.
AE applies administrative sanctions to its members and after the sanction no discharges of any kind are received.
In case of dissolution of accreditation, the sanctioned company will not have any option to re-accredit with AE.
Our verification inspectors do not require any permission to verify compliance with the standards proposed by AE.
Accredited companies are obliged to facilitate the work of each inspector and provide the required conditions during their stay.
Each inspector, upon determining non-compliance, will draw up a report at the time and those responsible will have to sign it confirming the work carried out by the inspector.
